- [Narrator] Anybody who
visits southern Thailand,
all Thais that come to southern Thailand,
and to Nakhon Si Thammarat,
they would never leave without
having a meal of kanom jeen.
(mid tempo music)

Hey everyone it's Mark Wiens,
I'm in (foreign language)
Nakhon Si Thammarat in souther Thailand

and this is a city that is
not all that well known,
it's not a big tourist destination,

but I think it's an amazing
city that you can visit.

So today I'm gonna take
you on a full tour of
of Nakhon Si Thammarat.

We're gonna eat some
amazingly delicious food
and visit some of the famous sites

and I can't wait to share
everything with you today
in this video.

We are starting off
this morning at a place,

it's just called Ko Pi and
that just means coffee,
but this is the local coffee shop.
This place is legendary.

They date back to 1942
and I love how this place
has preserved its heritage.
We ordered a couple of different things,

Ying was asking what
their specialties are,

but what most people, I
think, come here to eat
is the bak kut teh.

Bak kut the, it literally
translates to pork bone tea,
but there's actually usually,

I don't think there's ever
in any tea in the recipe,

but it's mostly like
a Chinese herbal broth
with pork bones and this one though,
includes a lot of extra ingredients.
There are some needle mushrooms in there.
There's some type of a green vegetable.

There's some other mushrooms
and some goji berries,
some dried goji berries.

Oh, oh, that almost

It has a
holiday spice aroma to it.
Oh, that is delicious.

And I got one of those little
sour goji berries in it too.

A piece of the pork bone,
that looks wonderful.
Look at that beauty.
That's flaming hot too!
That just falls off the bone.
Just a clean steaming bone.
Oh that's melt in your mouth tender.
That is ridiculously tender.

The meat has just absorbed

I just ordered a black coffee

traditional, the old school way,

and I watched him as a was
making a (foreign language).
Normally they put condensed milk in it

Yeah.
That is strong and black and it has a very

So it's actually, I really

You can taste a mixture

This is really good.
That was delicious.

That was a wonderful

there are a lot of Bangkok

Especially the center

It has a real mix of different cultures.
This is a great little city.

It's a must eat when you

It's about 500 meters away so
you could easily walk here.
(foreign language)

jeen, the rice noodles,

She's gonna show me real fast.
Oh very cool.

for the noodles that

You've got all the different curries,

the fresh rice noodles.

You eat the noodles with

There are so many

And then on the (foreign language)?

sticky consistency and if you

Okay, and that should be good to start.

You can kind of break

When you eat khanom jeen,
there is a trio of curries,

in the south, that is
the most popular trio.

And starting from this
side, this is nam ya kati,

which is a minced fish
curry with coconut milk.
And this one is nam prik,
which is more of a sweet peanutty curry,

and then the final curry
in the trio of curries
this is called nam ya ba.
I gotta start with the nam ya kati,
which is coconut milk and minced fish.
This is one of the absolute classics.
Oh yes!

And before doing anything else
I will take a bite of that.
Oh wonderful.

Oh yeah, that is just pure,
rich, thick coconut cream.

You can taste the turmeric

I'm tasting some lemon
grass in there as well.

And then the fish is very
pureed minced down there.

But it's also thick, not

These are cashew tree leaves

Let me show you.

They're awesome.

It is very coconutty and very peanutty.

Um that is a nice strong fishy taste.

A little bit of a kick to it.

and then they fry it into fritters.
Wow!

What's really good about
their version is that
it's not batter heavy.

This is like almost all leaves

And I think this would be

So they probably add

Um, that's delicious.

You can really taste the flavor

The green chilies in

It's really good, actually,

Oh yeah.

Basil.
This thing

And what I like is that it's a lot of food

feeling heavy or too...

It doesn't leave you feeling
greasy or oily or heavy

Even the rice noodles are

And then the curries just
provide immense flavor.
What a meal.
I'm so happy and satisfied right now.

Next up we are driving
over to a place called

Bann Tankhun and this

And this is an old, old

It's over 100 years old, this house,

What's cool is it's just

You can come in here, you've

I just did the math of

It was built 105 years ago

so that makes it that
it was built in 1912.
It was built in 1912.

Nakhon Si Thammarat, just like
other southern Thai cities,

is very diverse and it has
a real mix of cultures.
There is the local Thai and also Malay
in the south of Thailand,
but there's also a Chinese influence,

there is even a Shrilankan
influence that we saw
from that temple,

and that's all reflected
in the food and the culture
in Nakhon Si Thammarat.
